A collection of helper methods for working with Betfair prices.

Fields

PriceLadder

An array representing the price ladder used by Betfair.

public static double[] PriceLadder

Field Value

double[]

Methods

AddTick(double)

Adds a pip to the given price.

public static double AddTick(double price)

Parameters

price double

The base price.

Returns

double

The next price in the PriceLadder; if the given price is the highest, returns the highest price.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown when the provided price is not valid.

AddTicks(double, int)

Adds a specified number of pips to the given price.

public static double AddTicks(double price, int num)

Parameters

price double

The base price.

num int

The number of pips to add.

Returns

double

The price in the PriceLadder that is 'num' steps away from the given price; if it exceeds the ladder length, returns the highest price.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown when the provided price is not valid.

IsValidPrice(double)

Checks if the given price is valid by determining if it's present in the PriceLadder.

public static bool IsValidPrice(double price)

Parameters

price double

The price to validate.

Returns

bool

True if the price is present in the PriceLadder; otherwise, False.

RoundToNearestBetfairPrice(double)

Rounds the given price to the nearest valid price in the PriceLadder.

public static double RoundToNearestBetfairPrice(double price)

Parameters

price double

The price to round.

Returns

double

The nearest valid price from the PriceLadder.

SubtractTick(double)

Subtracts a pip from the given price.

public static double SubtractTick(double price)

Parameters

price double

The base price.

Returns

double

The previous price in the PriceLadder; if the given price is the lowest, returns the lowest price.

SubtractTicks(double, int)

Subtracts a specified number of pips from the given price.

public static double SubtractTicks(double price, int num)

Parameters

price double

The base price.

num int

The number of pips to subtract.

Returns

double

The price in the PriceLadder that is 'num' steps away from the given price in the negative direction; if it goes below the ladder length, returns the lowest price.
